newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Spectrum surges as access charges fall.
newsitem.headline: Spectrum surges as access charges fall.

text.p: Shares in Spectrum Network Systems Ltd soared more than 62 percent on Tuesday as the effect of the deregulation to Australia's telecommunictaions market kicked in.
At 3.25 p.m. (0525 GMT), Spectrum shares were 23 cents higher at 55 cents with over one million shares traded.
Traders said the lower access charge for Spectrum to buy telecommunications capacity fron telephone carriers would be positive for Spectrum's earnings.
Telecommunications regulator the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) set prices at access prices at 2.8 cents per minute from 4.4 cents per minute previously, effective on Tuesday.

"If you multiply that difference by two, you see that would translate to about three cents improvement in margins, which means that for every 100 million minutes of traffic they have, you have a three million improvement on the bottom line, subject to them holding their prices," one telecommunications analyst said.
"Basically, their earnings improvement as a result of that (change) means that they will get a kick-up," he said.
